tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids We will be encouraging people to ring 0800 80 70 60.

Find out about the latest regulatory position regarding Walleys Quarry #NewcastleUnderLyme on our dedicated webpage: https://t.co/o558iAVicn 

To report odour in the local area please email ics@environment-agency.gov.uk https://t.co/VOrWkWYi7r

@EnvAgencyMids By email? 😂You only get a reference if you constantly chase.The 1000s of calls should prompt immediate action to deal with the crisis & then regulate. You fail again&again continually to do this,shady practice,very shady @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA  #stopthestink @StinkStopthe

@AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE @markchapmanEA @EnvAgency @BritishDams @PhilWeltonEA @YorkshireWater @SevernTrentLife @NickLeMareEA @stwater Whilst the safety record is good, Ideally we need an emergency alert service using cell broadcast technology to rapidly warn and inform should the worst happen... 😉
@EnvAgencyMids Do your job properly and you won't get the calls. Simple!

This month I will be using Twitter to amplify women’s voices around the world. Find out why in the video below:
#ActOnTheGap #TogetherForOurPlanet #ChooseToChallenge @COP26 @EnvAgency @AdaptOurWorld https://t.co/aqDvcJTHEQ

tweets.text: @AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE @markchapmanEA @EnvAgency @BritishDams @PhilWeltonEA @YorkshireWater @SevernTrentLife @NickLeMareEA @stwater Good thread Adam, what does the plaque say, it’s too tiny to read?
@AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE @markchapmanEA There's some houses just outside loxley with flood height marks on them. Between loxley and high bradfield

Newly completed #floodplain reconnection project on Dunston Beck, Lincs, turning former arable field into diverse wetland & meadow habitats. #Partnership managed by WTT's Tim Jacklin along with landowners @beeswaxfarming and funding partner @EnvAgencyMids

Now & then shots https://t.co/O8xhJ6pvgK https://t.co/rBoSg6oazw

Many thanks indeed to the @CleanIlkley Team for inviting me along to your #Ilkley Town Meeting tonight - talking about the Bathing Water Status, improving the water quality in the River Wharfe and next steps with @YorkshireWater @bradfordmdc & @EnvAgency https://t.co/bKvJV8zgKW

Since 1984 things have improved & #reservoirs are really tightly regulated, the #UK now has one of the best safety records in the world.

Independently inspected & impressively maintained, these previous incidents serve as a reminder of why #regulation & #maintenance is integral. https://t.co/oW9yvDmzRq

@TW11Harbour @MariaHerlihyEA @RiverThames @EnvAgencySE @wifo_ea @MarkHill03 @sarahchareEA @MoretonBack1 That’s an old Sunfury 26 Mk1. Put that on the Fairline owners club and someone might snap that up ;)

Guy Linley-Adams solicitor for @SalmonTroutCons
reminds @CommonsEAC that water companies have a legal obligation to PROACTIVELY make their sewage data available. "It's exactly that information water users.... need before they get in the water".

So where is it @EnvAgency @Ofwat? https://t.co/S0zu7TCjWt

The following partners are onboard to charter a course to solve this issue #Wigan The very active @stormwater_jo , a new local river action group  @River_Douglas_ with support from catchment members @CRTNorthWest @WiganCouncil @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/6FPvUBeKUh

Welcome to the River Gaywood a pond dippers paradise🤥6 months ago I offered £100 to the @theriverstrust if any one could film a trout swim past in its crystal clear water🤢 @The_WMA @jamesowild @EnvAgencyAnglia @NaturalEngland @Feargal_Sharkey @N_Rivers_Trust @GlavenEel https://t.co/t4i7EM1GaF

Well after 1 yr how brill to be in a room with people! Today talking to @BritishArmy @RoyalAirForce @RoyalNavy liaison officers about @EnvAgency Incident Management. V much hoping we aren’t asking for there help anytime soon ! https://t.co/vyvaptReAS

We're launching a new project - NatureBid!

It awards funding to landowners in the Upper Aire to improve water quality & natural flood management. Works considered include leaky dams, tree planting & more!

More info 👉 https://t.co/pBJQjFTEiw

@EnvAgencyYNE @SylvaFoundation

The water level in the Sowy Flood Relief Channel up stream of Beer Wall has been lowered today to assist essential maintenance work being undertaken by the Parrett IDB on Friday. @EnvAgencySW @waterlevels

tweets.text: ‘Environment Agency contractor removing a major obstruction at #Molesey Lock Head Layby.’ Great team work by all Involved .⁦@EnvAgencySE⁩ ⁦@wifo_ea⁩ ⁦@MarkHill03⁩ ⁦@sarahchareEA⁩ ⁦@MoretonBack1⁩ https://t.co/Kl6d1FemI4

Well that was a stormy couple of days considering it wasn't a named #storm?! Plenty of #Cumbria #Rain too. Always amazes me how much more we get at #Honister and upper #Borowdale. 🌨️🌨️🌨️  @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice @metofficeNWEng @met https://t.co/e0W8DfEvmh

We have started installing steel sheet piles to strengthen flood defences along the River Witham at Dixon Street. 

This is part of the #Lincoln Flood Defence Programme which will reduce the risk of flooding. 

Sign up to our flood warnings: https://t.co/hquuoBJJ9d #jnbentley https://t.co/nXmvAQwUAE

We’ve seen the effects of climate change with flooding along the River Severn only recently. In the coming months we’ll be speaking with partners & communities about how we can better protect homes & businesses here: https://t.co/PVf8tdlRZc https://t.co/n4uB4CYl0D

Work has started on a #flood defence scheme for #Otley. We're working with #Leeds City Council on this scheme, which will reduce flood risk to 53 properties in the area around Wharfemeadows Park. @LeedsCC_News @BAMNuttall @MottMacDonald  @wsp 
https://t.co/5gwu72DeAy https://t.co/oGAwj9o3Vb
Can we have more of this in the Kent catchment please? Mass tree removal and concrete walls are not the solution... @EnvAgency @SouthLakelandDC @KendalSave @karenlloydwrite https://t.co/R7jddXmTVt

#OnThisDay in 1864 the #DaleDykeDam collapsed resulting in the #GreatSheffieldFlood. Believed to be caused by a crack in the embankment.

It released around 3million m3 of flood water through the #PeakDistrict & #Sheffield.

Sadly it resulted in 250 deaths & destroyed 600 homes. https://t.co/K6Ztk3gppI

@EnvAgencyMids @WildTroutTrust @beeswaxfarming @FarmerCarrott @JoannaS100 @IanWilloughby16 Fantastic result from all involved - demonstrates the power of collaboration @EnvAgencyMids @NRobinsonEA @WildTroutTrust #biodivercity #environment

A grainy picture but ace to see the leaky dams we installed last week have passed thier first BIG test with flying colours! V happy that there is still extra capacity behind each structure to slow / store larger storm events. @CumbriaCC @NTsouthlakes @SCRiversTrust  @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/ufXYSNovSM
@EnvAgencySE @MattBoughton93 Thank you for this.
@scottdegg @SimonTagg Public relations manoeuvre

@Newcast42068272 @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe In a poorly worded statement we forgot to mention that the Walleys Quarry #stinkfest is only temporarily closing.We can’t ignore the complaints, breaches & health issues #stopthestink festival fights for clean air goes on! It’s no use begging to ‘Don’t Stop Me Now’ @StinkStopthe https://t.co/WSmIpnXrpP

It’s a national scandal. @EnvAgency colluded to hide the disposal of 122k tonnes of non-conforming waste in a site not engineered for the purpose. They tried to sweep this under the carpet @FenlandCouncil. What are the pollution implications in a sensitive wetland like the fens? https://t.co/1emwJbO2RC

A major milestone is reached in a £4.8m Middlesbrough flood scheme as a new debris screen is installed. 

The Marton West Beck flood scheme will better protect nearly 500 homes in the town, and also includes new flood walls and drainage system.

Read more: https://t.co/BmpfFTCMRr https://t.co/GcAWc4MFkn

The Foss Barrier will be lowered this afternoon and the  riverside floodgates will be closed.
